text: hey <@UBS7QANF3>, unfortunately the Exchange has been splashed as a result of the empty market and event name strings that were being returned (and presumably other issues that these were symptomatic of); hopefully we'll be back online soon :crossed_fingers:

elements.text: hey

, unfortunately the Exchange has been splashed as a result of the empty market and event name strings that were being returned (and presumably other issues that these were symptomatic of); hopefully we'll be back online soon

text: Not sure <@ULDAVFDRP>, the missing market and event names were causing fatal errors all over my platform. A silly thing not to be robust against but it does reflect how unusual it is (haven't had to deal with such an issue in over three years)

, the missing market and event names were causing fatal errors all over my platform. A silly thing not to be robust against but it does reflect how unusual it is (haven't had to deal with such an issue in over three years)

text: > I guess so <@UBS7QANF3>, but id assume there should be validation on data entry / feeds so this shouldn't occur or should fail at a step earlier so market wasnt created. If this was a few hours later something so small probably would of cost a fair bit on a Saturday afternoon.

text: My CTO has said many times that the right plan with tech is to build things on the assumption “that everything fails all of the time” - words I applied for a decade before I came to work in his org. Very wise words that have served me well.
